decks.notes: This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while also controlling the game with Trinisphere. It then looks to close out the game quickly with powerful Dragon creatures like Thundermaw Hellkite, Glorybringer, and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker. The deck also has burn spells like Rolling Earthquake and Fiery Confluence to clear the opponent's board or finish off a weakened opponent. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive plays and disrupting the opponent's plans to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption. By utilizing cards such as Force of Will, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and take control of the match. Additionally, cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor provide card advantage and additional ways to control the game. Overall, this Grixis Control deck is designed to outmaneuver and outlast opponents in a game of attrition.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to create strong early game pressure by playing efficient and cheap threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Will while maintaining card advantage through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Kolaghan's Command to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized to support the three-color strategy while also including Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck focuses on using various means such as Crop Rotation, Sylvan Scrying, and Expedition Map to assemble the powerful combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in just one turn. It also includes disruption elements like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's hand and board state. By quickly assembling the combo and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

The deck focuses on using Life from the Loam and Knight of the Reliquary to control the board by recurring lands and searching for utility lands like Karakas and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. It also utilizes cards like Punishing Fire, Abrupt Decay, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck incorporates a Chalice of the Void and Gaddock Teeg to further disrupt the opponent's spells. The goal is to outvalue the opponent with card advantage from cards like Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library while controlling the game with land destruction from Wasteland and Ghost Quarter.

The main strategy of this UWx Control deck is to control the game by manipulating the opponent's hand and board, while also being able to quickly generate card advantage and threats. The deck relies on powerful instant speed spells like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Brainstorm to interact with the opponent's game plan. Key cards like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor provide additional value and win conditions. This deck aims to disrupt aggressive strategies and outvalue other control decks, eventually winning through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with cheap and efficient threats like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Deathrite Shaman while disrupting their game plan with cards like Lightning Bolt, Daze, and Cabal Therapy. The deck also utilizes disruptive lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to close out the game quickly through a combination of burn spells and creature damage, while also having interaction through counterspells like Force of Will. It focuses on being proactive and applying pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing counter spells, removal and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminus to deal with threats efficiently. The deck also has card selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help maintain a hand advantage. Finally, the win conditions come from powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Monastery Mentor, along with card advantage provided by Jace, the Mind Sculptor. This control archetype aims to outlast and outplay the opponent through careful resource management.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by constantly casting burn spells and attacking with creatures that have haste. The key strategy is to consistently apply pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize their board or gain life. The deck also utilizes cards like Price of Progress and Skullcrack to punish opponents for playing non-basic lands or gaining life. This aggressive playstyle aims to win the game as quickly as possible by overwhelming the opponent with direct damage.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a variety of versatile spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Hymn to Tourach. It also includes powerful threats like Snapcaster Mage and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to apply pressure and generate card advantage. The deck is able to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay while also utilizing planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage and control. Deathrite Shaman and Baleful Strix help stabilize the board and provide value throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Griselbrand to cheat big, powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield quickly. The deck utilizes a combination of card draw spells, counterspells, and fast mana sources to set up its combo efficiently. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures that can end the game in just a few swings, creating a high-risk, high-reward playstyle that can lead to explosive victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and countermagic such as Force of Will. The key strategy involves using creatures like Stoneforge Mystic to find powerful equipment like Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte to gain an advantage on board. Additionally, the combo of Splinter Twin with Deceiver Exarch and Pestermite provides a threatening win condition. The deck also has card advantage and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, allowing for flexibility in dealing with different threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies by utilizing low-cost, efficient creatures and disruption spells to apply early pressure on the opponent. It uses a mix of cheap spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan while also leveraging powerful cards like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support a mix of blue, black, and red spells while also utilizing powerful lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating advantage through card draw and token generation. The deck aims to use counterspells like Force of Will and Logic Knot to stop threats, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Cabal Therapy to deal with opposing creatures, and card selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up the next few turns. Additionally, the deck can use cards like Young Pyromancer and Vial Smasher the Fierce to generate tokens and put pressure on the opponent.

This control Stoneblade deck focuses on using powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic to generate card advantage and disrupt opponent's plans. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells like Force of Will and Counterspell to protect its threats, while also including removal like Swords to Plowshares to handle opposing threats. The inclusion of cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Chrome Mox allows for additional card selection and mana acceleration, providing the deck with flexibility and the ability to adapt to different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage, utilizing cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dack Fayden to generate value. It also leverages powerful cards like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Baleful Strix to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is able to maintain its resources with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Punishing Fire, while also having access to versatile threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The goal is to out-value the opponent and grind them out in a long game.
